intro: Calandrinia primuliflora, commonly known as the spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often resembling those of primroses. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Calandrinia primuliflora is often found in rocky habitats and is known for its early blooming period in spring.
